soc.client

Class ColorSquareLarger

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • soc.client.ColorSquare
            • soc.client.ColorSquareLarger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class ColorSquareLarger
extends ColorSquare
    This is a larger square box with a background color and possibly a number or X in it. See ColorSquare javadoc for details and behavior.

    Because ColorSquares and their dimensions are used widely, having this subclass limits the changes needed for larger squares for player interaction.

    Since:
    1.1.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorSquareLarger

        public ColorSquareLarger(java.awt.Color c)
        Creates a new ColorSquareLarger with specified background color and without a visible value. Non-interactive. Calls ColorSquare.ColorSquare(Color).

        A tooltip with the resource name is created if c is one of the resource colors defined in ColorSquare (CLAY, WHEAT, etc, or an element of RESOURCE_COLORS).

        Parameters:
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • ColorSquareLarger

        public ColorSquareLarger(int k,
                         boolean in,
                         java.awt.Color c)
        Creates a new ColorSquareLarger of the specified kind and background color. Possibly interactive. For kind = NUMBER, upper=99, lower=0. Calls ColorSquare.ColorSquare(int, boolean, Color).

        A tooltip with the resource name is created if c is one of the resource colors defined in ColorSquare (CLAY, WHEAT, etc, or an element of RESOURCE_COLORS).

        Parameters:
        k - Kind: NUMBER, YES_NO, CHECKBOX, BOUNDED_INC, BOUNDED_DEC
        in - interactive flag allowing user interaction
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color

      • ColorSquareLarger

        public ColorSquareLarger(int k,
                         boolean in,
                         java.awt.Color c,
                         int upper,
                         int lower)
        Creates a new ColorSquare of the specified kind and background color. Possibly interactive, with upper and lower bounds specified for NUMBER kinds.

        A tooltip with the resource name is created if c is one of the resource colors defined in ColorSquare (CLAY, WHEAT, etc, or an element of RESOURCE_COLORS).

        Parameters:
        k - Kind: NUMBER, YES_NO, CHECKBOX, BOUNDED_INC, BOUNDED_DEC
        in - interactive flag allowing user interaction
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color
        upper - upper bound if k == NUMBER
        lower - lower bound if k == NUMBER
